normalised: Energy and Utilities - Solar Rooftop Subsidies

unnormalised: Good news, folks! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) just sweetened the pot for rooftop solar! Forget sweating it out in the Delhi heat – generate your own power and save some serious Rs.
normalised: Good news, folks! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) just sweetened the pot for rooftop solar! Forget sweating it out in the Delhi heat – generate your own power and save some serious rupees.

unnormalised: Word on the street is, they've extended the rooftop solar subsidy scheme until March 31st, 2026! That's plenty of time to get your applications in. We're talking subsidies up to 40% for systems up to 3kW! Perfect for lighting up your average Mumbai apartment.
normalised: Word on the street is, they've extended the rooftop solar subsidy scheme until March thirty first, two thousand and twenty six! That's plenty of time to get your applications in. We're talking subsidies up to forty percent for systems up to three kilowatt! Perfect for lighting up your average Mumbai apartment.

unnormalised: Thinking bigger? You can still get 20% subsidy for systems between 3kW and 10kW. Even Dr. Sharma down the street is considering it for his sprawling bungalow in Chandigarh.
normalised: Thinking bigger? You can still get twenty percent subsidy for systems between three kilowatt and ten kilowatt. Even Doctor Sharma down the street is considering it for his sprawling bungalow in Chandigarh.

unnormalised: Imagine – reduced electricity bills and bragging rights at your next Diwali party! Plus, you'll be contributing to a greener India.
normalised: Imagine – reduced electricity bills and bragging rights at your next Diwali party! Plus, you'll be contributing to a greener India.

unnormalised: The process is relatively simple, just reach out to your DISCOM or a registered vendor. Many like Tata Power Solar are now empanelled.
normalised: The process is relatively simple, just reach out to your D I S C O M or a registered vendor. Many like Tata Power Solar are now empanelled.

unnormalised: Don't miss out! Start planning your installation now. Think of all the extra lassi you can buy with the savings! The subsidy is based on the capacity, and typically, 1kW needs about 100 sq ft. So, measure up your roof and get going!
normalised: Don't miss out! Start planning your installation now. Think of all the extra lassi you can buy with the savings! The subsidy is based on the capacity, and typically, one kilowatt needs about one hundred square feet. So, measure up your roof and get going!
